p: Sphingosin kinases (SphK) are lipid kinases that mediate conversion of sphingosine to bioactive lipid sphingosine 1-phosphate (S1P) ( 67), a known modulator of central apoptotic pathways ( 68). IAV infections leads to increased expression and activation of SphK1 and SphK2 ( 29) and in vitro inhibition of SphK1 was shown to decrease IAV RNA synthesis via suppression of NFkB activation ( 69). Treatment of mice with specific inhibitors to either SphK1 or SphK2 or a pan-SphK inhibitor led to prolonged survival of mice following lethal IAV infection ( 29).
